v.v: Indeed, my heart trembles at this;
Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice,
He sends it out under the whole sky,
A voice roars after it;
God thunders marvelously with his voice;
For he says to the snow, ‘Fall on the earth’;
He stops the hand of every man from working,
Then the beasts go into hiding
The storm comes from its chamber in the south
By the breath of God ice is given;
Indeed, he weighs down the thick cloud with moisture;
He swirls the clouds around by his guidance,
He makes all of this happen; sometimes it happens for correction, sometimes for his land,

v: it is moved out of its place.
the sound that goes out from his mouth.
and he sends out his lightning to the edges of the earth.
he thunders with the voice of his majesty;
he does not restrain the lightning bolts when his voice is heard.
he does great things that we cannot comprehend.
likewise to the rain shower,
‘Become a great shower of rain.’
so that all people whom he has made may see his deeds.
and stay in their dens.
and the cold from the scattering winds in the north.
the expanse of the waters is frozen like metal.
he scatters his lightning through the clouds.
so that they may do whatever he commands them
above the surface of the whole world.
and sometimes as acts of covenant faithfulness.

v.v: Listen to this, Job;
Do you know how God establishes the clouds
Do you understand the floating of the clouds,
Do you understand how your garments become hot
Can you spread out the sky as he can—
Teach us what we should say to him,
Should he be told that I wish to speak with him?

v: stop and think about God’s marvelous deeds.
and makes the lightning bolts to flash in them?
the marvelous deeds of God, who is perfect in knowledge?
when the land is still because the wind comes from the south?
the sky, which is as strong as a mirror of cast metal?
for we cannot lay out our arguments in order because of the darkness of our minds.
Would a person wish to be swallowed up?

v.v: Now, people cannot look at the sun when it is bright in the sky
Out of the north comes golden splendor—
As for the Almighty, we cannot find him!
Therefore, people fear him.

v: after the wind has passed through and has cleared it of its clouds.
over God is fearsome majesty.
He is great in power;
he does not oppress justice and abundant righteousness.
He does not pay any attention to those who are wise in their own minds.”
